preqs: ETF5900 or equivalent or MGX5961 or MGX5690.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETF5900, MGF5690, MGF5961, MGX5690, MGX5961} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Must have enrolled in an (I/W) unit in {MGX5690, MGX5961}

proh: Master of Applied Econometrics students should not undertake this unit.
description: This unit complements students' practical understanding of business practices by introducing quantitative techniques in optimisation. Of particular interest are those techniques designed to improve the efficiency and transparency of supply chains, retailing and operations. Topics covered include quantitative techniques for forecasting, waiting lines, process modelling, logistics, resource planning and e-commerce. Students will learn to apply such methods in business settings.
